website_summaries.verdict: This inspirational kit includes 3 sets representing some of the most influential women in NASA history.
pros: Nancy Grace Roman with Hubble Space telescope, Margaret Hamilton with stack of books representing flight source codes, and Sally Ride and Mae Jemison mini-figures with Challenger Space Shuttle
Comes with building instructions and information about the women
cons: Less complex than other LEGO Ideas kits
Does not take very long to build

customer_reviews.title: Great design work, Lego!
customer_reviews.text: Great set! Be an educated buyer though; at time of this writing price gougers are asking 3x list price but it's not even sold out on lego's website. I received my set today and am very happy. The instruction manual has a little biography on each featured woman in the set which is great for those who may not know why these women are such pioneers. An unexpected but appreciated design perk is that each minifig's face is double sided; you get to choose between big smile vs pleasant at rest face.
customer_reviews.author: third time mom

customer_reviews.title: Great set, get the book too!
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say that hasn't been said already, but it really is a nice set. I definitely recommend getting the book that pairs up with this if you are getting this for an early reader. I got this for my daughter whom I homeschool and we did a space unit with this which included the book. Just be aware that the space shuttle that comes with this is really tiny, I feel some of the pictures are using a bit of forced perspective to make it seem a little bigger, but it's about two mini-figures plus a head tall. Great set to subtly reinforce some positive motivation in young children that they can do whatever they want.
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Nice little $25 set. A pox on all 36 pages of scalpers charging more than MSRP for this set.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little $25 set. A pox on all 36 pages of scalpers charging more than MSRP for this set. Be patient. LEGO is still making more copies of this set, and it will show up again for $25. Just remember, if you buy from a scalper this time, they will use that money to buy the next "hot" item and overcharge you for that one too.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Great set, can't wait to give it to my ...
customer_reviews.text: Great set, can't wait to give it to my daughter for Christmas. Don't give in to the price gougers, though, this is a new and non-retired set and shouldn't cost more than $25!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Great set for fun and learning!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful set for imaginative play and learning about space and NASA History, plus its LEGO so you can’t go wrong. The only toy I buy for my 6 & 8 yr old grandkids and they never get tired of building and role play. Wonderful for their imaginations and creativity and they get such a sense of accomplishment with every build! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: nascar lover

customer_reviews.title: Educational and Fun
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic set, it's rare that you can have fun and learn at the same time but LEGO knows what they are doing. Just make sure you pay less than 30 for it, sadly it seems to be out of stock everywhere right now but trust me it's worth the wait.
customer_reviews.author: LizE

customer_reviews.title: Pretty lame set, despite what it stands for.
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our daughter as her first Lego set. The space shuttle is really great and a great beginner build, that looks cool despite its simplicity. The rest of the set, however, is a dud. Most of your time will be spent building the 3 bases that are almost all identical. One of the three is supposed to literally be a pile of books. A pile of books! "Oh great woman of space history, you will be forever remembered for your...pile of books." Ridiculous! The third is a satellite that is okay, but pretty weak as well. Not work the price. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Weezies

customer_reviews.title: Love the Theme, But Needs More Building
customer_reviews.text: The space shuttle is the most intricate build in this one, where the theme may be more impressive than the actual Lego. My space-loving son enjoyed it, but did wish there were more rocket-centric stuff to assemble. Even an old-fashioned computer would have been a nice addition. Really needed something to assemble to capture kid's imaginations.
customer_reviews.author: SWTop Contributor: Architecture

customer_reviews.title: Great theme (esp in these misogynistic times), cool mini builds
customer_reviews.text: Loved the informative bios on the four women, great theme to promote these days (given the terrible anti-women stances people seem willing to display now). And especially good to promote science during the anti-science sentiments in our country now. Cool builds (the space shuttle is really cute for its size, and unusual Studs-Not-On-Top setup). Amazingly topical for its release, frankly, so i applaud Lego for making this set and its timing.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Chin

customer_reviews.title: Loved this little set!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously. Big nerd here which probably helps a bit. But, this set of 3 mini sets is pretty awesome. The little satellite, constructed of a LEGO trash can brick, is my favorite. It's not a "trash" satellite, but as we've gotten used to from LEGO, creative re-use of bricks. The shuttle is my second favorite, as it's a pretty remarkable bit of brick engineering to get something that's essentially a fully featured toy out of so few pieces. Anyway, it's fun, it's easy, and it's super nerdy. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: ArkhamTheRev

customer_reviews.title: Great set for all interested!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter and she loved it! So wonderful seeing sets like this to shower young girls what they can do if they put their mind to it. Don't get me wrong, my daughter loves playing with the Lego Friends set but this is a great one for her! Kinda like i switch between light action books and deeper historical books. Both are fun depending on your mood!
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Incredible piece of history from Lego!
customer_reviews.text: Just an incredible piece of history from Lego! We love this set. I had tears in my eyes when the Space Shuttle, Challenger, was finished. Although the manufacturers recommended ages are 10 and up, I think an 8 year old would be fine with it. We are experienced builders and have Lego sets of all age ranges and abilities. Definitely a Lego Set to be displayed or enjoyed. As a personal favorite, this one will be displayed in our home. I may have to buy a second one for play!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia

customer_reviews.title: Ummmm...it's LEGO
customer_reviews.text: At first I thought that some history/information would have been nice, but now I much prefer that the four women inspired us to do our own research. With the wealth of on-line and library info we were led far beyond the lives and works of these previously unknown to most people NASA scientists. I wanted Hubble for myself and gave the rest to my daughter (adult leader of LEGO loving children.) We love LEGOs and science. Perfect match. Edited: two misspellings.
customer_reviews.author: Jawbc

customer_reviews.title: An amazing set I gifted my ‘astronaut’ obsessed nephew
customer_reviews.text: An amazing set I gifted my ‘astronaut’ obsessed nephew. Would love to see a noteworthy male’ NASA LEGO set as we actively promote equal gender visibility in my family, and I’d love for him to have such an awesome setup of male astronauts on his dresser as these remarkable women currently displayed- he literally tells everyone whom visits the house about the special NASA figures on his dresser!
customer_reviews.author: LolaGrace

customer_reviews.title: I have yet to open this, but I absolutely ...
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to open this, but I absolutely had to own it. I bought it assuming I'd give it to my daughter as a Christmas gift, but when it arrived, I just couldn't part with it. I think I'll let them help me build it some day.. haha
customer_reviews.author: Acorn2010

customer_reviews.title: Imagination and Play: While celebrating history.
customer_reviews.text: We are a lego loving family, and I find that their products enable adults and children to have countless joyful hours of using their imagination in play. I purchased this as a gift for a family member who has a connection to NASA, and she loved it. I am sure at some point the pieces will be reassembled by children visiting her office to make some new toy, but that is beauty of dreaming about building and exploring new places.
customer_reviews.author: DAvid G. Center

customer_reviews.title: My 8 and 5 year old daughters had a blast building these.
customer_reviews.text: Got this set along with the accompanying book for my daughters as a fun surprise for doing so well on their latest report cards. We had a great time building these, looking through the book and learning about these women who helped us reach for the stars. Highly recommended, especially for any young lady you know who is interested in science or space.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy J. Ward

customer_reviews.title: I love space and I love Legos
customer_reviews.text: I love space and I love Legos! I am underwhelmed by this set :( The quality is excellent, but the build time is very short... I think this one is over priced, I hope they continue with the NASA themed sets (the Apollo one was excellent).
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great set, bought on sale for $20
customer_reviews.text: Amazing set with good historical value - great for collectors and students of space sciences. I bought this for review purposes that I did on YouTube, but I also enjoyed building the set and learning more about the 4 amazing women of NASA immortalized in the set. Great for the money (as long as it's not over $25)
customer_reviews.author: Terragon

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for grown women too!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this Lego set for myself! Retail is $24.99, don't pay more! It was fun to put together and looks amazing on display. My only complaint is some of the peices aren't as sturdy as they should be. It's not enough to knock a star off for, just be aware when putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Vala M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought multiple sets to gift to my nieces. So far it has been a huge hit. I definitely recommend a set for the kids in your life, especially if they love to put Lego sets together. This one does have small pieces, but even the four year old was excited about putting it together with help from her parents.
customer_reviews.author: Nancye Rahn

customer_reviews.title: Very cool, but a little pricey
customer_reviews.text: They are very cool. Even for adults. I purchased them for my wife, who is in the science field, and she loved them. My only complaint is they are kindof expensive for what they are. I know most Legos are pricey and these are special, and they were worth it to make her happy. However, if she didn't have the level of interest that she does in science and space, I don't know if they'd been worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Brody Robinaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great for curious girls!
customer_reviews.text: My 4.5yr old is obsessed with space and Mae Jemison so this was the absolute perfect gift for her. She certainly wasn’t able to put the whole thing together by herself just yet, but she was able to help me construct it and really loves the figurines. What a great way to nurture a little girl’s love of science!
customer_reviews.author: MeaghanW

customer_reviews.title: Simple but solid
customer_reviews.text: A simple set, but done well. The booklet inside has additional information on each woman.
customer_reviews.author: PurelyNicole

customer_reviews.title: NASA represent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my grand daughters before, this on is for me. I wish Katherine Johnson was represented, but this is a good set to have if you're into NASA space-themed builds.
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: WHOMEN of MASA
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this set. It reminds us of the accomplishments of women in NASA. It reminds us of pewdiepie's WHOMEN! It reminds us of the MASA of "Swatcats: the Radical Squadron." It's an awesome set!
customer_reviews.author: I am not a number, I am a free man!

customer_reviews.title: What a delightful set! It shipped quickly, and ...
customer_reviews.text: What a delightful set! It shipped quickly, and was originally intended as a Christmas gift for a friend. But when it arrived, I was so excited about it, I immediately got in my car and delivered it as an early Christmas gift. This was assembled immediately, and is so darn cute, I can't even stand it.
customer_reviews.author: Juniper

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful commemorative set!
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous set! My 5 year old granddaughter has loved the stories of these brave and brilliant women and has mastered putting the set together with ease. Directions are very easily followed. It has sparked her interest in all phases of space exploration.
customer_reviews.author: S Cumbus

customer_reviews.title: LEGO “ideas” is a great theme!
customer_reviews.text: The “ideas” theme is my favorite. The adult fans of lego(afol) submit really awesome creations and the LEGO community at large is able to vote for their favorites. These sets are realized in the ideas theme which leads to an extensive variety.
customer_reviews.author: taylor h

customer_reviews.title: super cool
customer_reviews.text: super cool toys. Both boys and girls like it. My son is a huge fan of lego.
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous addition to our collection
customer_reviews.text: Fabulous set, and great for any Lego and NASA collector. I got this set for my husband who loves NASA. They had not let Lego use their logo previously, so it is an amazing set to have that authenticity. Wonderful to celebrate women who are often overshadowed. The small vignettes look great amongst other collectables featuring Hubble and the shuttles.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Educational.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a Christmas gift for a granddaughter. She enjoys biographies, legos, and science. It should be a winner. I will write follow up after Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: K. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: We love this set!
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift to my 6 year old daughter: she loves it! She's read several books about female astronauts and really loves having these to play with and display in her room. Her older brother has enjoyed looking at it and learning about the women featured as well. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: hawkeyeinks

customer_reviews.title: ... on this the first time it was released but fortunately, I was able to snag it the second ...
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to get my hands on this the first time it was released but fortunately, I was able to snag it the second go round. What a wonderful gift and knowing no one else was able to get one made it even more special.
customer_reviews.author: Tomi @Three Boys and an Old Lady

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my wife for Christmas. She keeps it on her desk at school. Kids and visitors all love it. It's been disassembled and reassembled several times already ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Daddy Fix

customer_reviews.title: Overall great
customer_reviews.text: First platform build is kind of lame, shuttle and telescope are great. Awesome commemorative booklet, and overall a great set
customer_reviews.author: Z

customer_reviews.title: Great to have role models for young girls to play ...
customer_reviews.text: Great to have role models for young girls to play with, but wish the women featured were more representative of the women of NASA, including Asian and Latina.
customer_reviews.author: Erika

customer_reviews.title: Nice for Space Lovers
customer_reviews.text: Great Lego addition and checks off a few boxes Nice for girls and those who love space or might be interested in it Thumbs up and recommend
customer_reviews.author: silly string

customer_reviews.title: Excellent LEGO Set - Educational and Fun!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this set! I work at JSC and so I was thrilled to be able to give this LEGO set of NASA Women to my granddaughters (7 and 5) - who assembled it in a jiffy. We also looked up each woman on Wikipedia and read more about her life and contribution to space exploration.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Lins

customer_reviews.title: Super cool set!
customer_reviews.text: Not a whole lot of pieces for the price, but overall an awesome set. I bought this for my daughter and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Great Set
customer_reviews.text: So pleased to find women of NASA represented. Enjoyed the build and the results. Including the information about each of these intelligent & groundbreaking women is a great resource.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa DeChiara

customer_reviews.title: Great display set
customer_reviews.text: If you're a lego and space fan, this is a great gift. Fun little builds with a great history behind them.
customer_reviews.author: xxxx

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite LEGO sets ever
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could give each and every kid this set.
customer_reviews.author: rebizzy

customer_reviews.title: Great, but an easy build.
customer_reviews.text: They are as hey appear. But could have been more challenging/fun to build. My 7 yr old was a little disappointed it was so easy and we aren’t LEGO building buts or anything.
customer_reviews.author: DaKs

customer_reviews.title: Fun to put together as a woman in STEM
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely LOVE these! As someone in their upper-20s, this was my FIRST true experience with Legos. I finally caved and bought the set for the 50th Anniversary of the Apollo 11 mission and LOVED putting these together leading up to the event (I caved because of Margaret Hamilton who helped with the coding for the mission). I work in a STEM field and this is so great to see that Lego decided to support Women in STEM. Now let's get more!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Stember

customer_reviews.title: A fun build that highlights some lesser known backroom stars some ...
customer_reviews.text: A fun build that highlights some lesser known backroom stars some rather more famous NASA folk. the booklet has little bios of all four women scientists, so there is educational value as well. This sits on my shelf at work. As a bonus, the shuttle model is very good, a very concise attractive build.
customer_reviews.author: stevenpirie

customer_reviews.title: Quick to build, nice display pieces.
customer_reviews.text: Great set. I love the Lego Ideas sets because they're fun little builds I can do in 1 or 2 hours, and they make nice little display pieces. These are definitely simple enough for children to build whether they have experience with Lego or not, but have a nice enough final product to display as an adult collector. Definitely putting these up next to my Lego Ideas Birds set.
customer_reviews.author: Kaiden Eterali

customer_reviews.title: So cool!
customer_reviews.text: Fun to put together, innovative design, and look great on my office shelf. Be aware, these are designed for display, not for play.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 11 year old girl loved getting this as a gift!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my grandaughter. She is 11 and loved it!! Can't go wrong with Legos!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy and fun for my 10 year old.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 10 year old daughter and she loved it! This is her second lego set, her first one was DC Comics Wonder Woman...she said it was very easy to build and the details were cool. I want to keep buying her more so that she can have a collection!
customer_reviews.author: JAMS

customer_reviews.title: Great Easy Lego set.
customer_reviews.text: Put this together with my four year old. He was able to put it together with little assistance. I was also glad to add some Women to our Mini-figure collection.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Morlan

customer_reviews.title: LEGO Ideas are the best
customer_reviews.text: One of my favorite sets next to the Saturn Rocket. Makes for a great display next to the rocket and the Creator Shuttle set. The instruction manual is really nice with the added information about each of the ladies.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Powerful set for your LEGO-lover!
customer_reviews.text: This set is perfect for any little one in your life. It was especially meaningful for my 7 year old to see these amazing women in LEGO form.
customer_reviews.author: L. Noll

customer_reviews.title: Great LEGO set
customer_reviews.text: We loved this set. My five year old picked it and was able to assemble it on his own. It’s really cute and detailed!
customer_reviews.author: Ash

customer_reviews.title: Love the kit, love the theme!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little Kit! 3 notable women in space, and the instructions made it super easy to get together
customer_reviews.author: The Rev

customer_reviews.title: Great especially with the matching book!
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loved these!! Got the matching book and she was totally enthralled!!
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Love Legos
customer_reviews.text: Loved the set. The booklet that came with it was great. It talked about each woman in the set. My son and I had fun putting them together.
customer_reviews.author: Christineh

customer_reviews.title: LEGO Ideas 21312 Women of NASA
customer_reviews.text: Good value and good fun as it there is bad fun. Enjoyed the reaction from the giftee
customer_reviews.author: William O. Ross Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for young girls!
customer_reviews.text: This is a Great gift for young girls. My sister gave one to our 9-year-old daughter, and now we’ve purchased a couple to use as birthday gifts for some of her friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ma Mu

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS! Perfect for young girls.
customer_reviews.text: Love this set. This set got my oldest daughter to learn about some women she had not known before. Now, she is completely enthralled with and idolizes Dr. Mae Jemison. It's a great little set and hope LEGO does more like this.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Celebration of geeks
customer_reviews.text: There aren't nearly enough celebrations of geeks, male or female, in children's toys. I especially enjoy the celebration of math and computer programming.
customer_reviews.author: R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lego Tribute to NASA Women
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Lego building kit for our Granddaughter who adores NASA. She was floored when she received it and plans to set it up in her office.
customer_reviews.author: Esteban

customer_reviews.title: Great model
customer_reviews.text: Model is very accurate and fun to build. Not to challenging for younger kids. Definitely a great representation of these women and a small tribute to their accomplishments
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Ordered these as a gift with my nephew. He loved the set! Great gift!
customer_reviews.author: Sh12298

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful lego set idea
customer_reviews.text: My 11yr old daughter loves this lego set! She even researched each of the women and got to know more of their background work and careers. This is a wonderful lego set idea!!
customer_reviews.author: reviewer08-20-2011

customer_reviews.title: Great LEGO set for girls that love space
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this set! So excited to order it as soon as it came out. Great prouduct. Fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Owens

customer_reviews.title: Inspirational and Fun
customer_reviews.text: This was a big hit with my daughter. She wants to be an aerospace engineer - I was so happy to be able to give her a gift with real women who she can admire.
customer_reviews.author: bookie

customer_reviews.title: Such a great lego
customer_reviews.text: My son is into lego's. I got him this one to show him diversity in NASA as most space stuff sold has men. My son loved it and he had my husband tell him all about the woman.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: It's a win
customer_reviews.text: gave as gift and was told it was fun and easy to put together.
customer_reviews.author: S.J.I.

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality
customer_reviews.text: High quality as always with any LEGO product. No pieces missing and everything was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: Educative!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent activity set for a small group in a classroom. We used with a book to learn about womayin NASA.
customer_reviews.author: J Diaz

customer_reviews.title: Such a great set! I was sad that Katherine Johnson ended ...
customer_reviews.text: Such a great set! I was sad that Katherine Johnson ended up not being a part of the set -- but thrilled with it otherwise. My daughter LOVES this lego set and I am so glad to see women in science being celebrated like this.
customer_reviews.author: stacytr

customer_reviews.title: NASA Women ROCK
customer_reviews.text: This made a great present for my "nieces" and for their mom who is a wonderful woman with two goddesses to raise. I am so glad to provide them science oriented playthings.
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte Henley Babb

customer_reviews.title: Great set. Very happy to see LEGO publish it
customer_reviews.text: Great set. Very happy to see LEGO publish it, hope to see more in this vein. One teensy problem: the date of the photograph of Margaret Hamilton next to the stack of her Apollo software should be 1969, not 1959.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Bunyan

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Was worth the purchase price I paid (it was on sale). Nice set.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Dresbach

customer_reviews.title: Cute and a good history lesson.
customer_reviews.text: The models went right together by following the directions. Love having these reminders of women’s contributions to space research and travel around!
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Small

customer_reviews.title: very cool lego set
customer_reviews.text: This was a very cool lego set. My 6 yr old daughter had a lot of fun building it and now displays it on her desk. It and the info included has been a great way to feed her budding interest in space.
customer_reviews.author: d

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful play set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my daughter. She loves it. We even had a good experience requesting missing pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Women Super Heroes
customer_reviews.text: We like the LEGO set. It was nice to see women in science and not just as super hero types....although these women ARE super heroes in their own right..
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Wilder

customer_reviews.title: I love the informative book too
customer_reviews.text: Cute little desk decorations. I love the informative book too.
customer_reviews.author: J.F.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter who is in the science field. She loved it! Legos are great, just wish they weren't so expensive
customer_reviews.author: Jodi Brito

customer_reviews.title: If someone loves Legos they will love this
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it once it's put together though it is very small it's not a large set but the historical aspect is very good
customer_reviews.author: Kittens07

customer_reviews.title: Girl Power
customer_reviews.text: I'm so glad I found this kit! Gave one as a gift and kept one.
customer_reviews.author: Ana G.

customer_reviews.title: Recognizing Women’s Accomplishments at NASA!
customer_reviews.text: So important to recognize the women who have accomplished great things at NASA and this set did just that! The set also showed a variety of careers, which added to its importance. Gifted to my great granddaughter and I hope it will someday be sitting in her office as she adds her own accomplishments to the science/math field.
customer_reviews.author: Family traveler

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and educational
customer_reviews.text: I have these displayed in my office where I work with kids and they have been a great conversation piece about women and STEM.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great set
customer_reviews.text: My teenage daughter loves this set and had it assembled within a short time after opening it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kane

customer_reviews.title: Love this set
customer_reviews.text: Love this set! We got lucky and ordered it the day it came out. I wish Lego would make more sets for women/girls like this (instead of pink boxes!).
customer_reviews.author: Great Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great biographical information on the scientists
customer_reviews.text: Great informational booklet about the lives of the women featured. My kids loved building and playing with this while reading about the scientists.
customer_reviews.author: TheBlueAnura

customer_reviews.title: Daughter and i loved this set
customer_reviews.text: Daughter and i loved this set. i really wish there were lots more like this as it serves not only for fun but inspirational and educational at the same time
customer_reviews.author: Alitos

customer_reviews.title: This is such a cool set! I hope LEGO makes more of the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool set! I hope LEGO makes more of the women in science / technology sets. The price was better on Amazon than other places.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy K

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great set especially when accompanied by the Lego Women of NASA Space Hero`s book
customer_reviews.author: R R

customer_reviews.title: Great product - LEGO rocks
customer_reviews.text: This sends a very positive message to the many young girls who need a role model in the STEM fields. Thank you for making this product available.
customer_reviews.author: A lady

customer_reviews.title: More please...
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this set. It's a beautiful addition to my "real" space Lego collection. I wish that Lego would release more sets like this.
customer_reviews.author: Scrybe Suttles

customer_reviews.title: I do love it! Using it in a meeting to talk ...
customer_reviews.text: I do love it! Using it in a meeting to talk about Women and their contributions to space.
customer_reviews.author: Jane S. Nelson-Comp

customer_reviews.title: I really like this set
customer_reviews.text: I really like this set. I display it in my room because it reflects the type of person I aspire to be, therefore, I am quite happy that women in science were recognized by the creator and think it's fun they turned it into a lego set for people like me to enjoy. It was a bit smaller than expected, but not by much so I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Madysen

customer_reviews.title: Great Educational LEGO Set
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loved this LEGO set. Not super difficult to put together, but a great idea that planted the seed for further research on female scientists.

customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these for my daughters. They had a great time building them and enjoyed the characters. I would buy this again if I needed to.

customer_reviews.text: Glad I got one as its always sold out. Might get a second to store away for a future gift. Really nice build and I found it on Amazon for retail price!!
customer_reviews.author: Todd W.

product_meta.title: LEGO Ideas 21312 Women of NASA (231 Pieces)
product_meta.description: Explore the professions of some of the groundbreaking women in science, technology, engineering and mathematics (STEM) with the LEGO Ideas Women of NASA set. It features minifigures of 4 pioneering women of NASA— astronomer and educator Nancy Grace Roman, computer scientist and entrepreneur Margaret Hamilton, astronaut, physicist and entrepreneur Sally Ride and astronaut, physician and engineer Mae Jemison—and 3 builds illustrating their areas of expertise. Role-play space exploration from planning to moon landing, beginning with the iconic scene from Massachusetts Institute of Technology in 1969 of Hamilton with software that she and her team programmed. Build the posable Hubble Space Telescope and launch a LEGO version of the Space Shuttle Challenger with 3 removable rocket stages. The set also includes a booklet about the 4 featured women of NASA, and the fan creator and LEGO designers of this fun and educational set.
feature_bullets: Features 3 LEGO builds illustrating the areas of expertise of the 4 featured women of NASA
Includes 4 minifigures: Nancy Grace Roman, Margaret Hamilton, Sally Ride and Mae Jemison
Nancy Grace Roman’s build features a posable Hubble Space Telescope with authentic details and a projected image of a planetary nebula
Margaret Hamilton’s build features a stack of book elements, representing the books of listings of Apollo Guidance Computer (AGC) onboard flight software source code
Sally Ride and Mae Jemison’s build features a launchpad and Space Shuttle Challenger with 3 removable rocket stages
Includes a booklet with building instructions, plus information about the 4 featured women of NASA, the set’s fan creator and the LEGO designers
Nancy Grace Roman’s build measures over 2" (7cm) high, 3” (9cm) wide and 2” (6cm) deep, Margaret Hamilton’s build measures over 2" (6cm) high, 3” (8cm) wide and 1” (4cm) deep
Sally Ride and Mae Jemison’s build measures over 4" (12cm) high, 3” (10cm) wide and 2” (6cm) deep. Recommended age: 10 years and up
